internal.database

Class LinHash<K,V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • internal.database.LinHash<K,V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<K,V>

    public class LinHash<K,V>
extends AbstractMap<K,V>
implements Serializable, Cloneable, Map<K,V>
    This class provides hash maps that use the Linear Hashing algorithm. A hash table is created that is an array of buckets.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  LinHash.Bucket
      This inner class defines buckets that are stored in the hash table.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.util.AbstractMap

        AbstractMap.SimpleEntry<K,V>, AbstractMap.SimpleImmutableEntry<K,V>

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface java.util.Map

        Map.Entry<K,V>

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Class<K> classK
      The class for type K.
      private Class<V> classV
      The class for type V.
      private int count
      Counter for the number buckets accessed (for performance testing).
      private List<LinHash.Bucket> hTable
      The list of buckets making up the hash table.
      private int mod1
      The modulus for low resolution hashing
      private int mod2
      The modulus for high resolution hashing
      private static int SLOTS
      The number of slots (for key-value pairs) per bucket.
      private int split
      The index of the next bucket to split.

        classK - the class for keys (K)
        classV - the class for keys (V)
        initSize - the initial number of home buckets (a power of 2, e.g., 4)
